column4: U.S. Labor department sues Google for compensation data
column5: The U.S. Department of Labor said on Wednesday it filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's  Google unit seeking access to the company's compensation data and documents as part of a routine compliance evaluation.

column4: U.S. Labor department sues Google for compensation data
column5: The U.S. Department of Labor said on Wednesday it filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's  Google unit seeking access to the company's compensation data and documents as part of a routine compliance evaluation.

column4: Amazon doubles deliveries in 2016 for third-party sellers
column5: Amazon.com Inc  shipped 50 percent more items during the past holiday season than the prior year for third-party vendors and doubled the amount for 2016 overall  the world's largest online retailer said on Wednesday. | Video

column4: Sanofi  Regeneron lose bid to overturn Amgen win in patent case
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday refused to throw out a court verdict upholding two Amgen Inc patents related to the company's cholesterol drug  a defeat for Sanofi SA and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc  which make a rival drug.

column4: Apple confirms $1 billion investment in SoftBank tech fund
column5: Apple Inc  confirmed on Wednesday its plans to invest $1 billion in a tech fund being set up by Japan's SoftBank Group Corp .

column2: Barclays Inverse US Treasury Composite ETN
column4: Ex-Barclays trader pleads guilty in U.S. in forex probe
column5: NEW YORK A former Barclays Plc  trader pleaded guilty on Wednesday to U.S. charges arising from a global investigation into the manipulation of foreign-exchange prices at major banks  the U.S. Department of Justice said.

column4: Gilead poaches Novartis cancer specialist Riva
column5: ZURICH Gilead Sciences has hired a top cancer specialist from Swiss drugmaker Novartis as the U.S. healthcare group sharpens its focus on oncology.

column4: Heron drug for post-surgery pain succeeds in midstage trial
column5: Heron Therapeutics Inc on Wednesday said its experimental combination drug for post-operative pain led to significant reductions in pain intensity and the need for opioids  according to initial data from a midstage trial.

column4: BMW  Intel  Mobileye to test 40 driverless cars in second half of 2017
column5: BERLIN BMW's alliance with Intel and Mobileye aims to put a fleet of around 40 self-driving test vehicles on the road in the second half of this year  the companies said.

column4: Sanofi  Regeneron lose bid to overturn Amgen win in patent case
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday refused to throw out a court verdict upholding two Amgen Inc patents related to the company's cholesterol drug  a defeat for Sanofi SA and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc  which make a rival drug.

column4: Tesla starts battery cell production at gigafactory
column5: Electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc has started mass production of lithium-ion battery cells at its gigafactory in Nevada along with Japan's Panasonic Corp  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Gilead poaches Novartis cancer specialist Riva
column5: ZURICH Gilead Sciences has hired a top cancer specialist from Swiss drugmaker Novartis as the U.S. healthcare group sharpens its focus on oncology.

column4: Maersk  Alibaba team up to offer online booking of ship places
column5: SHANGHAI Maersk  the world's largest container shipping line  has teamed up with Alibaba  to allow customers to reserve space on its vessels through the Chinese company  illustrating growing cooperation between e-commerce and logistics firms.

column4: Alibaba  in new tack  sues two vendors who it says sold fake watches
column5: HONG KONG China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd has sued two vendors it says sold fake Swarovski watches on its Taobao e-commerce platform  its first legal action against counterfeiters amid persistent allegations that fake goods are widely available on its sites.

column4: AT&T to conduct 5G network trials for DirecTv Now customers
column5: AT&T Inc said it plans to test its high-speed wireless 5G network  which reached speeds of 14 gigabits per second in lab trials  for customers of its online streaming television service  DirecTv Now  in Austin  Texas.

column4: Ex-Barclays trader pleads guilty in U.S. in forex probe
column5: NEW YORK A former Barclays Plc  trader pleaded guilty on Wednesday to U.S. charges arising from a global investigation into the manipulation of foreign-exchange prices at major banks  the U.S. Department of Justice said.

column4: Tough labor talks could lead to strike at Escondida copper mine: union
column5: SANTIAGO Workers at BHP Billiton-owned Escondida  the world's biggest copper mine  could go on strike in February if collective contract talks with the company are unsuccessful  union spokesman Carlos Allende told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: BlackRock's U.S.-based active funds post record 2016 withdrawals: Morningstar
column5: NEW YORK Investors pulled $19.3 billion from BlackRock Inc's  U.S.-based actively managed mutual funds in 2016  Morningstar Inc estimates showed on Tuesday  a record high as the investment industry struggles to restrain an exodus to lower-cost investments.

column4: Boeing wins $8.8 billion in 737 MAX orders  still short of goal
column5: SEATTLE Boeing Co  said on Wednesday it had booked firm orders for 80 of its 737 MAX 8 aircraft  valued at $8.8 billion at list prices  upping its 2016 tally but leaving it short of its goal.

column4: Brazil's BRF launches unit focused on Muslim food markets
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's BRF SA has launched a unit focused on the Muslim processed foods market  underscoring efforts by the world's No. 1 poultry exporter to gain market share in the oil-rich Middle East.

column4: CBS signs deal to be on Hulu's live-streaming platform
column5: CBS Corp has signed a deal to have its broadcast network and some cable programming on Hulu's live streaming service  which is expected to go live this year  the companies said Wednesday.

column4: Sinopec mandates 6 banks to advise on unit revamp ahead of IPO-IFR
column5: HONG KONG China Petroleum and Chemical Corp (Sinopec)  has mandated six banks to advise it on a restructuring of its fuels distribution unit ahead of a planned initial public offering in Hong Kong  IFR reported on Wednesday  citing people close to the deal.

column4: Lawsuit in U.S. says Coca-Cola downplays risks of sugary drinks
column5: Coca-Cola Co and the American Beverage Association trade group were sued on Wednesday for allegedly misleading consumers about the health risks from consuming sugary beverages.

column4: Delta Air Lines forecasts smaller drop in key revenue measure
column5: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Wednesday it expected a smaller decline in fourth-quarter passenger unit revenue  a closely watched metric  than it had previously forecast  citing strong demand in December.

column4: Exxon Mobil  Tillerson agree to cut all ties
column5: Exxon Mobil Corp and Rex Tillerson agreed to sever all ties to comply with conflict-of-interest requirements as the company's former chairman and chief executive awaits confirmation as U.S. secretary of state. | Video

column4: Canadian fintechs shine as investments near record
column5: TORONTO Venture capital-backed investment in Canadian financial technology companies hit its highest level in almost two decades last year  even as the flow of funds into major fintech markets like the United States declined  according to sector data.

column4: Televisa says FCC approves higher Univision stake threshold
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexican broadcaster Televisa said on Wednesday the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) had given approval for Televisa to own up to 40 percent of U.S. Spanish-language peer Univision's voting stock and up to 49 percent of its common shares.

column4: Investors hold fewest net shorts on U.S. Treasuries since November: JPM
column5: NEW YORK The margin on bearish bets on longer-dated U.S. Treasuries over bullish positions shrank to its smallest since late November as bargain-minded investors emerged after the recent bond market selloff  a J.P. Morgan survey released on Wednesday showed.

column4: Judge halves $1 billion award in J&J hip implants case
column5: A U.S. judge almost halved the award in a December jury verdict that ordered Johnson & Johnson  and its DePuy Orthopaedics unit to pay more than $1 billion to plaintiffs in six lawsuits who said they were injured by DePuy's Pinnacle hip implants.

column4: KBR defeats appeal in U.S. over Nepal  Iraq trafficking claims
column5: A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday refused to hold KBR Inc  liable for alleged human trafficking  in connection with the 2004 kidnapping and murder by insurgents of 12 Nepali men being transported in Iraq to work for a subcontractor at a U.S. military base.

column4: Samsung Electronics in talks with LG Display for LCD panel supply: Yonhap
column5: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is in talks with South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd about a potential liquid crystal display (LCD) panel supply deal for televisions  South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported on Wednesday.

column4: Competition watchdog sees concerns with MasterCard's VocaLink deal
column5: LONDON Britain's competition watchdog said it has concerns with  MasterCard Inc's  acquisition of UK payment processing company VocaLink Holdings  following a review of the ownership and competitiveness of companies supporting those systems.

column4: McDonald's opens near Vatican  upsetting some purists
column5: VATICAN CITY McDonald's has opened a franchise just steps away from the gleaming white marble dome of St. Peter's Basilica  giving indigestion to some cardinals and local business owners.

column4: ArcelorMittal  CSN  Usiminas raising Brazil flat steel prices: sources
column5: SAO PAULO Brazilian flat steel producers have notified distributors they are raising prices of hot- and cold-rolled steel between 8 percent and 10 percent this month  a steel market source and an analyst said on Wednesday.

column4: Greek prosecutor raids Novartis Athens offices in bribery probe
column5: ATHENS Greek prosecutors have raided the Athens offices of Swiss drugmaker Novartis  as part of a probe into bribery allegations  a court official told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Gilead poaches Novartis cancer specialist Riva
column5: ZURICH Gilead Sciences has hired a top cancer specialist from Swiss drugmaker Novartis as the U.S. healthcare group sharpens its focus on oncology.

column4: Sanofi  Regeneron lose bid to overturn Amgen win in patent case
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday refused to throw out a court verdict upholding two Amgen Inc patents related to the company's cholesterol drug  a defeat for Sanofi SA and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc  which make a rival drug.

column4: Amos Genish resigns from Telefónica Brasil's board
column5: SAO PAULO Amos Genish resigned from the board of Telefónica Brasil SA and will be replaced by José María Del Rey Osorio  according to a securities filing on Wednesday.

column4: U.S. chief justice steps aside in patent case over stock conflict
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Chief Justice John Roberts will no longer participate in a patent dispute at the Supreme Court involving a unit of Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc after he realized he owns about $175 000 of stock in the company  the court said on Wednesday.

column4: Tyson Iowa pork plant resumes operations day after fire
column5: CHICAGO Tyson Foods Inc's hog processing plant in Storm Lake  Iowa  returned to normal operations on Wednesday following a fire at the facility on Tuesday night  a company spokeswoman said in an email.

column4: Board of Brazil's Vale taps Jorge Buso Gomes as vice-chairman
column5: SAO PAULO The board of Brazil's Vale SA tapped Fernando Jorge Buso Gomes as vice-chairman  to replace Sergio Figueiredo Clemente.

column4: France to suspend sales of Vitamin D supplement after infant's death
column5: PARIS France has started measures to suspend sales of a Vitamin D supplement marketed as Uvesterol D after the death of a baby who had been given a dose of it  a French medical safety watchdog said on Wednesday.
